verses.iast:
parāśaraṃ munivaraṃ kṛtapūrvāhṇikakriyam
maitreyaḥ paripapraccha praṇipatyābhivādya ca
verses.translation: Maitreya, having bowed and offered respects, questioned the eminent sage Parāśara after his morning rites.

verses.iast:
tvatto hi vedādhyayanam adhītam akhilaṃ guro
dharmaśāstrāṇi sarvāṇi vedāṅgāni yathākramam
verses.translation: From you, O teacher, I have studied the Vedas, all the Dharma-śāstras, and the Vedic auxiliaries in due order.

verses.iast:
tvatprasādān muniśreṣṭha mām anye nākṛtaśramam
vakṣyanti sarvaśāstreṣu prāyaśo ye 'pi vidviṣaḥ
verses.translation: By your favor, O best of sages, even the ill-disposed will proclaim me learned in the scriptures, without undue toil.

verses.iast:
so 'ham icchāmi dharmajña śrotuṃ tvatto yathā jagat
babhūva bhūyaś ca yathā mahābhāga bhaviṣyati
verses.translation: Therefore I wish to hear from you, O knower of dharma, how the world arose, arises again, and will be hereafter.

verses.iast:
yanmayaṃ ca jagad brahman yataś caitac carācaram
līnam āsīd yathā yatra layam eṣyati yatra ca
verses.translation: Of what the universe is made, O brāhman; whence this moving and unmoving arises; how and where it was dissolved and where it returns.

verses.iast:
yatpramāṇāni bhūtāni devādīnāṃ ca saṃbhavam
samudraparvatānāṃ ca saṃsthānaṃ ca yathā bhuvaḥ
verses.translation: What the measures of beings are, the origin of gods and others, and the arrangement of oceans, mountains, and the earth.

verses.iast:
sūryādīnāṃ ca saṃsthānaṃ pramāṇaṃ munisattama
devādīnāṃ tathā vaṃśān manūn manvantarāṇi ca
verses.translation: The structure and measure of the sun and others; the lineages of gods; the Manus and the Manvantaras.

verses.iast:
kalpān kalpavikalpāṃś ca caturyugavikalpitān
kalpāntasya svarūpaṃ ca yugadharmāṃś ca kṛtsnaśaḥ
verses.translation: The aeons and their varieties according to the four yugas; the nature of a kalpa’s end and the duties of each age.

verses.iast:
devarṣipārthivānāṃ ca caritaṃ yan mahāmune
vedaśākhāpraṇayanaṃ yathāvad vyāsakartṛkam
verses.translation: The lives of gods, seers, and kings; and how Vyāsa duly arranged the Vedic branches.

verses.iast:
dharmāṃś ca brāhmaṇādīnāṃ tathā cāśramavāsinām
śrotum icchāmy ahaṃ sarvaṃ tvatto vāsiṣṭhanandana
verses.translation: I wish to hear from you, O son of Vasiṣṭha, the duties of the classes and the stages of life.

verses.iast:
brahman prasādapravaṇaṃ kuruṣva mayi mānasam
yenāham etaj jānīyāṃ tvatprasādān mahāmune
verses.translation: O brāhman, turn your mind graciously toward me, that by your grace I may understand this.

verses.iast:
§parāśara uvāca:
sādhu maitreya dharmajña smārito 'smi purātanam
pituḥ pitā me bhagavān vasiṣṭho yad uvāca ha
verses.translation: Parāśara said: Well said, O Maitreya— you have reminded me of the ancient teaching my grandsire Vasiṣṭha declared.

verses.iast:
viśvāmitraprayuktena rakṣasā bhakṣito mayā
śrutas tātas tataḥ krodho maitreyāsīn mamātulaḥ
verses.translation: A demon set on by Viśvāmitra devoured my father—so I heard; then anger arose in me, O Maitreya.

verses.iast:
tato 'haṃ rakṣasāṃ satraṃ vināśāya samārabham
bhasmīkṛtāś ca śataśas tasmin satre niśācarāḥ
verses.translation: I began a rite to destroy the rākṣasas, and in that session hundreds of night-roamers were reduced to ashes.

verses.iast:
tataḥ saṃkṣīyamāṇeṣu teṣu rakṣaḥsv aśeṣataḥ
mām uvāca mahābhāgo vasiṣṭho 'smatpitāmahaḥ
verses.translation: As the rākṣasas were being annihilated almost completely, my revered grandsire Vasiṣṭha addressed me.

verses.iast:
alam atyantakopena tāta manyum imaṃ jahi
rākṣasā nāparādhyante pitus te vihitaṃ tathā
verses.translation: Enough of intense anger, my son—give up this wrath; the rākṣasas are not at fault; it was ordained by your father.

verses.iast:
mūḍhānām eṣa bhavati krodho jñānavatāṃ kutaḥ
hanyate tāta kaḥ kena yataḥ svakṛtabhuk pumān
verses.translation: Anger is for the deluded; how could it befit the wise? Who kills whom, since each person experiences his own acts?

verses.iast:
saṃcitasyāpi mahatā vatsa kleśena mānavaiḥ
yaśasas tapasaś caiva krodho nāśakaraḥ paraḥ
verses.translation: Even what men amass with great effort—fame and ascetic merit—anger utterly destroys, my child.

verses.iast:
svargāpavargavyāsedhakāraṇaṃ paramarṣayaḥ
varjayanti sadā krodhaṃ tāta mā tadvaśo bhava
verses.translation: The supreme seers always avoid anger—the cause that obstructs heaven and liberation; do not fall under its sway.

verses.iast:
alaṃ niśācarair dagdhair dīnair anaparādhibhiḥ
satraṃ te viramatv etat kṣamāsārā hi sādhavaḥ
verses.translation: Enough of burning these pitiable, not-truly-guilty night-roamers; let this rite cease—the good are grounded in forbearance.

verses.iast:
evaṃ tātena tenāham anunīto mahātmanā
upasaṃhṛtavān satraṃ sadyas tadvākyagauravāt
verses.translation: Thus persuaded by that great-souled father, I at once ended the rite, out of respect for his words.

verses.iast:
tataḥ prītaḥ sa bhagavān vasiṣṭho munisattamaḥ
saṃprāptaś ca tadā tatra pulastyo brahmaṇaḥ sutaḥ
verses.translation: Then the blessed Vasiṣṭha rejoiced; and Pulastya, son of Brahmā, arrived there.

verses.iast:
pitāmahena dattārghyaḥ kṛtāsanaparigrahaḥ
mām uvāca mahābhāgo maitreya pulahāgrajaḥ
verses.translation: Honored with arghya by the grandsire and seated, the illustrious elder brother of Pulaha addressed me, O Maitreya.

verses.iast:
§pulastya uvāca:
vaire mahati yad vākyād guror asyāśritā kṣamā
tvayā tasmāt samastāni bhavāñ chāstrāṇi vetsyati
verses.translation: Pulastya said: Because you took refuge in your teacher’s word and patience in great enmity, you will know all the scriptures.

verses.iast:
saṃtater na mamocchedaḥ kruddhenāpi yataḥ kṛtaḥ
tvayā tasmān mahābhāga dadāmy anyaṃ mahāvaram
verses.translation: Since even in anger you did not sever the lineage, I grant you, O blessed one, another great boon.

verses.iast:
purāṇasaṃhitākartā bhavān vatsa bhaviṣyati
devatāpāramārthyaṃ ca yathāvad vetsyate bhavān
verses.translation: You will compose a Purāṇa-saṃhitā, dear one, and know the true import of the deities.

verses.iast:
pravṛtte ca nivṛtte ca karmaṇy astamalā matiḥ
matprasādād asaṃdigdhā tava vatsa bhaviṣyati
verses.translation: In action and renunciation your mind will be stainless; by my grace, dear one, it will be free of doubt.

verses.iast:
tataś ca bhagavān prāha vasiṣṭho me pitāmahaḥ
pulastyena yad uktaṃ te sarvam etad bhaviṣyati
verses.translation: Then my grandsire Vasiṣṭha said: All that Pulastya has spoken to you will indeed come to pass.

verses.iast:
iti pūrvaṃ vasiṣṭhena pulastyena ca dhīmatā
yad uktaṃ tat smṛtiṃ yātaṃ tvatpraśnād akhilaṃ mama
verses.translation: Thus what Vasiṣṭha and the wise Pulastya formerly taught has all come back to my memory through your question.

verses.iast:
so 'haṃ vadāmy aśeṣaṃ te maitreya paripṛcchate
purāṇasaṃhitāṃ samyak tāṃ nibodha yathātatham
verses.translation: Therefore I shall relate the Purāṇa-saṃhitā to you in full, O Maitreya; listen exactly as it is.

verses.iast:
viṣṇoḥ sakāśād udbhūtaṃ jagat tatraiva ca sthitam
sthitisaṃyamakartāsau jagato 'sya jagac ca saḥ
verses.translation: From Viṣṇu the universe arises and in Him it remains; He is the agent of its preservation and withdrawal—He is the All.

verses.iast:
§parāśara uvāca:
avikārāya śuddhāya nityāya paramātmane
sadaikarūparūpāya viṣṇave sarvajiṣṇave
verses.translation: Parāśara said: To Viṣṇu—the unchanging, pure, eternal Supreme Self, of single, constant form, the all-victorious—(obeisance).

verses.iast:
namo hiraṇyagarbhāya haraye śaṃkarāya ca
vāsudevāya tārāya sargasthityantakāriṇe
verses.translation: Salutation to Hiraṇyagarbha, to Hari, to Śaṅkara; to Vāsudeva, the savior, who effects creation, sustenance, and end.

verses.iast:
ekānekasvarūpāya sthūlasūkṣmātmane namaḥ
avyaktavyaktarūpāya viṣṇave muktihetave
verses.translation: Obeisance to Him of one-and-many forms, gross and subtle; to Viṣṇu whose forms are manifest and unmanifest, the cause of liberation.

verses.iast:
sargasthitivināśānāṃ jagato yo jaganmayaḥ
mūlabhūto namas tasmai viṣṇave paramātmane
verses.translation: Homage to that Supreme Self Viṣṇu—root of the universe—who pervades the world and is creation, maintenance, and dissolution.

verses.iast:
ādhārabhūtaṃ viśvasyāpy aṇīyāṃsam aṇīyasām
praṇamya sarvabhūtastham acyutaṃ puruṣottamam
verses.translation: Having bowed to the Acyuta, Supreme Person, support of the universe and subtler than the subtlest, dwelling in all beings.

verses.iast:
jñānasvarūpam atyantanirmalaṃ paramārthataḥ
tam evārthasvarūpeṇa bhrāntidarśanataḥ sthitam
verses.translation: He whose essence is knowledge, utterly pure in truth; yet seen by the deluded as identified with objects.

verses.iast:
viṣṇuṃ grasiṣṇuṃ viśvasya sthitisarge tathā prabhum
praṇamya jagatām īśam ajam akṣayam avyayam
verses.translation: Bowing to Viṣṇu—the Lord who absorbs and creates the universe; the unborn, undecaying, imperishable Lord of worlds.

verses.iast:
kathayāmi yathāpūrvaṃ dakṣādyair munisattamaiḥ
pṛṣṭaḥ provāca bhagavān abjayoniḥ pitāmahaḥ
verses.translation: I shall narrate as before what the lotus-born grandsire told when questioned by Dakṣa and other sages.

verses.iast:
taiś coktaṃ purukutsāya bhūbhuje narmadātaṭe
sārasvatāya tenāpi mama sārasvatena ca
verses.translation: By them it was told to King Purukutsa on the banks of the Narmadā, then to Sārasvata, and by Sārasvata to me.

verses.iast:
paraḥ parāṇāṃ paramaḥ paramātmātmasaṃsthitaḥ
rūpavarṇādinirdeśaviśeṣaṇavivarjitaḥ
verses.translation: The Supreme beyond all things, the Supreme Self abiding in itself, devoid of determinations like form and color.

verses.iast:
apakṣayavināśābhyāṃ pariṇāmarddhijanmabhiḥ
varjitaḥ śakyate vaktuṃ yaḥ sadāstīti kevalam
verses.translation: Free from decline, destruction, transformation, growth, and birth; of Him one may say only: ‘He ever simply is.’

verses.iast:
sarvatrāsau samastaṃ ca vasaty atreti vai yataḥ
tataḥ sa vāsudeveti vidvadbhiḥ paripaṭhyate
verses.translation: Since He abides everywhere and all abides in Him, the learned recite Him as Vāsudeva.

verses.iast:
tad brahma paramaṃ nityam ajam akṣayam avyayam
ekasvarūpaṃ ca sadā heyābhāvāc ca nirmalam
verses.translation: That Brahman is supreme, eternal, unborn, undecaying, imperishable—ever of one nature and immaculate, since none other exists.

verses.iast:
tad eva sarvam evaitad vyaktāvyaktasvarūpavat
tathā puruṣarūpeṇa kālarūpeṇa ca sthitam
verses.translation: That alone is all this, having manifest and unmanifest form; it abides as the Person and as Time.

verses.iast:
parasya brahmaṇo rūpaṃ puruṣaḥ prathamaṃ dvija
vyaktāvyakte tathaivānye rūpe kālas tathāparam
verses.translation: The Person is the first form of the Supreme Brahman; besides the manifest and unmanifest there is another form—Time.

verses.iast:
pradhānapuruṣavyaktakālānāṃ paramaṃ hi yat
paśyanti sūrayaḥ śuddhaṃ tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam
verses.translation: What the sages behold as pure, beyond matter, person, manifest and time—that is Viṣṇu’s supreme abode.

verses.iast:
pradhānapuruṣavyaktakālās tu pravibhāgaśaḥ
rūpāṇi sthitisargāntavyaktisadbhāvahetavaḥ
verses.translation: Matter, person, manifest, and time—distinct modes—are causes of subsistence, creation, dissolution, manifestation.

verses.iast:
vyaktaṃ viṣṇus tathāvyaktaṃ puruṣaḥ kāla eva ca
krīḍato bālakasyeva ceṣṭāṃ tasya niśāmaya
verses.translation: The manifest is Viṣṇu, the unmanifest the Person, and Time as well—behold His play, like that of a child.

verses.iast:
avyaktaṃ kāraṇaṃ yat tat pradhānam ṛṣisattamaiḥ
procyate prakṛtiḥ sūkṣmā nityā sadasadātmikā
verses.translation: The unmanifest cause is called Pradhāna by the foremost seers—subtle, eternal Prakṛti of the nature of both being and non-being.
